title: Copperplate Gothic Lowercase
content: Curious minds want to know... Has anyone ever attempted to design a lowercase companion to Copperplate Gothic?
author: armin

comments.content:
Hi Armin. You need yourself a [FontBook](http://web.archive.org/web/20140502055510/http:/typophile.com/wiki/FontBook). The following are all cross-referenced from the Copperplate entry.

[American Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20140502055510/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/urw/urw_american_gothic/)  
 [ITC Serif Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20140502055510/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/itc_serif_gothic_std/)  
 [ITC Newtext](http://web.archive.org/web/20140502055510/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/itc/itc_newtext/)  
 [ITC Elan](http://web.archive.org/web/20140502055510/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/itc/itc_elan/)
Well dang, just noticed they are reffed in one direction but not the other. Will fix that in the next edition.

Well, at 10:16 I was ready to buy it. But after your comment at 10:23 I am certainly not. "Not referenced both ways"... Ludicrous!

Thanks : )
There are 7,400 cross-references created by hand. We probably missed a few links.

So... I have done 85,000 cross-references by hand and never missed any. So...
